Secretary to Chairman & Marketing Manager (Female) Job at Kingrock International Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Kingrock International Nigeria Limited, Founded in 2012, our company is a leading player in Nigeria’s mining industry. Headquartered in Abuja, we specialize in the exploration, development, and processing of mineral resources across the country. With a strong commitment to sustainable practices, safety, and technological innovation, we have built a reputation for excellence and reliability in the sector. Our dynamic team and forward-thinking leadership continue to drive growth and expansion in both local and international markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary to Chairman & Marketing Manager (Female)
     

            
    



Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage executive scheduling, administrative operations, and cross-functional PR initiatives
	Oversee project lifecycles: Planning → Implementation → Monitoring → Reporting
	Serve as primary liaison for internal/external stakeholders with timely communication
	Conduct performance analysis and deliver executive briefings
	Coordinate high-level meetings and business engagements.


Requirements


	Educational background: Senior high school diploma minimum (Bachelor’s degree from top-tier universities preferred)
	≤26 years old | Height ≥165cm
	Exceptional personal presence:Professional image, polished demeanor, and strong etiquette awareness
	Foundational qualities:Proactive mindset, cultural sensitivity, and grace under pressure
	Technical proficiency: Advanced computer literacy (MS Office Suite required; CRM tools a plus)


Core Requirements:
Professional Excellence:


	International corporate exposure (preferred)
	Business fluency in English (clear articulation) + Chinese proficiency (advantageous)
	Demonstrated business etiquette and personal brand consciousness


Personal Attributes:


	Impeccable grooming and socially adept disposition
	Growth mindset with commitment to continuous improvement
	Unquestionable integrity and loyalty to organizational values


Operational Competencies:


	Self-driven project execution with end-to-end ownership
	Leadership aptitude: Team coordination + conflict resolution
	Advanced writing skills for executive communications
	Strategic networking capabilities across cultures.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV with professional photo to: timztm007@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	For more information Whatapp: 09096622222
	Only female candidates will be considered per business requirements

Logistics Officer Job at Excel and Grace Consulting




        
    

        
        Excel and Grace Consulting is a fast-paced business consulting organization with a track record of delivering exceptional business solutions to small and medium-scale enterprises in Nigeria, Ghana, Germany, Switzerland, Canada, etc. We are certified management consultants with the International Council of Management Consulting Institutes (CMC-Global) with over 18 years of experience. Our team of experts and consultants have authored over 20 books on business management, business structure, business operations, human resources, organizational structure, employee development, money management, and so on.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Schedule: Monday to Saturday

Job Summary


	We are seeking a reliable and experienced Logistics Officer to manage the efficient movement and storage of goods and materials.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for coordinating daily logistics operations, ensuring timely delivery, managing inventory, and liaising with vendors, suppliers, and transport providers.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate and monitor supply chain operations
	Ensure premises, assets, and communication ways are used effectively
	Utilize logistics IT systems or databases to optimize procedures
	Supervise orders and arrange stocking of materials and equipment
	Plan and track the shipment of final products according to customer requirements
	Keep logs and records of warehouse stock, executed orders, etc.
	Prepare accurate reports for management
	Maintain proper documentation of incoming and outgoing goods
	Liaise and negotiate with transport companies, suppliers, and customers
	Enforce health and safety procedures within logistics operations


Requirements and Qualifications


	Minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field
	Proven experience in logistics or supply chain management
	Solid knowledge of logistics procedures and systems
	Excellent organizational and time-management skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
	Proficiency in MS Office and logistics software (e.g., ERP) is an advantage
	Familiarity with the Lagos road network and traffic patterns is a plus.


Salary
N200,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@eandg.com.ng and eandg.tprecruiters@gmail.com using "Logistics Officer – Iyana Ipaja" as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Repton Group
content:
Repton Group is a company registered in Nigeria with the Corporate Affairs Commission to carry out business in general commerce, distribution, haulage, agriculture and allied services. We are major Lafarge, Dangote, and Bua cement distributors across Nigeria. We distribute products across the 36 states of the Federation including FCT Abuja. In addition, we haul products from the factories in Obajana, Kogi State, Gboko, Benue State, Ibese, Ogun State and numerous distribution and sales depots. We also operate own strategic depots across the country with a goal to make the products available to Project sites and end user locations. We are long standing Lafarge Cement & Dangote Cement Distributor respectively. Thus, we are very familiar with both the industry and the markets.

	HND, BSc or MSc in Management or any related field.
	3-8 years of experience in the same role.

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV in PDF to: recruitment@reptongroup.ng using the Job Title as the subject of the mail. 

 

 

2.) Area Sales Manager

	Applicant must reside around Ondo, Ekiti and Akure.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@reptongroup.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties


	Develop, implement, and maintain compliance policies, procedures, and controls to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements.

	Monitor and report on compliance issues, providing recommendations for improvement.

	Provide training and guidance to employees on compliance policies and procedures.
	Conduct audits and reviews to ensure compliance with internal policies and regulatory requirements.
	Manage and respond to compliance-related queries and complaints.
	Stay up-to-date with changes in regulatory requirements and update policies and procedures accordingly.

Brand Manager Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Brand Manager
Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	Responsible for overseeing brand and product development, pricing, forecasting, campaigns, asset development, and driving brand mental availability in the market


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Brand activity planning
	Project management
	Research briefing and Data analysis
	Managing strategic brand campaigns
	Organizing market visits itinerary and sharing reports from visits
	Ensuring compliance with brand guidelines on all creatives
	Demand cycle - assumption and forecasting
	Budget management -Bottom-up, allocation, tracking, and communicating
	Collaboration with 3P
	Price tracking vs SPI & API
	Media- Reach ambition and platform maximization.


Requirements
Qualifications / Experience


	First degree in Business, Marketing, Communication, or related field. An MBA or a master’s in marketing is desirable.
	4-5 years’ work experience in brand management with knowledge of trade marketing, consumer marketing, research, and product development in the FMCG sector.


Competence Requirements:


	Good communication and presentation skills
	Good experience in the brand planning process
	Commercial acumen, confident, enthusiastic, and persuasive
	Convincing personality, good planner, self-starter, and committed to results.


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Paid Time Off
	Training & Development.
